other.name: Silent Bodyguard
other.description: While a Character model is leading this unit, each time an attack targets this unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than this unit’s Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: Deathshroud Terminators are swollen with the fell powers of their diseased patron. With every swing of their huge scythes they decapitate and disembowel their foes, their speed belied by their bloated mass. They fight in ominous silence, embodying the inevitable onset of their enemies’ death.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: plaguespurt gauntlet; manreaper.
datasheets.name: Deathshroud Terminators
wargear: The Deathshroud Champion can be equipped with 1 additional plaguespurt gauntlet.
leadBy: Death Guard Chaos Lord in Terminator Armour
Death Guard Sorcerer in Terminator Armour

other.name: Tank Hunters
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack that targets a Vehicle unit, add 1 to the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: Belching stinking gases that hang thick in the air, Myphitic Blight-haulers use their all-terrain mobility and heavy armaments to hunt down the enemy’s tanks and provide fire support even in the most dangerous environments. Should the enemy get too close, these Daemon Engines pounce with fanged maws and sprays of bile.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bile spurt; missile launcher; multi-melta; gnashing maw.
datasheets.name: Myphitic Blight-Haulers
wargear: None

other.name: Gift of Contagion (Psychic)
other.description: In your Shooting phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this Psyker and roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker’s unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2+, until the start of your next Shooting phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes a melee attack, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

other.name: Pestilent Fallout (Psychic)
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, if one or more of those attacks made with its Plague Wind scored a wound against an enemy Infantry unit, until the start of your next turn, subtract 2 from that unit’s Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

datasheets.fluff: Every foetid fibre of a Malignant Plaguecaster’s body is rotted and decayed. They are living conduits for the Garden of Nurgle’s miasmas and maladies. Foul blights reside within their roiling, bloated frames, and when they are unleashed in an eruption of vomit and gases they liquefy metal, stone and flesh.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague bolt pistol; Plague Wind; corrupted staff.
datasheets.name: Malignant Plaguecaster
wargear: None

other.name: Chaos Lord
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

other.name: Desiccation Conduit (Aura)
other.description: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this model, at the end of the turn, roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

composition: 1 Death Guard Chaos Lord in Terminator Armour
datasheets.fluff: Every Death Guard lord is a formidable opponent, dripping with infectious disease and armed to the teeth with toxin-smeared weaponry. Those clad in diseased Terminator armour are yet more deadly. Their nigh on impregnable plate is fused with their flesh, bulging and hardened thanks to Nurgle’s blessings, making them even more durable.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Blightlord Terminators ■ Deathshroud Terminators
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague combi-bolter; plague-encrusted exalted weapon.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Chaos Lord in Terminator Armour

stats.name: Death Guard Chaos Lord in Terminator Armour

wargear: This model’s plague combi-bolter and plague-encrusted exalted weapon can be replaced with 1 twin lighting claws.
This model’s plague-encrusted exalted weapon can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 chainfist ◦ 1 plague fist
This model’s plague combi-bolter can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague-encrusted exalted weapon

other.name: Self Repair
other.description: At the start of your Command phase, this model regains 1 lost wound.

datasheets.fluff: Clad in a cocoon of slime-smeared armour plating, Death Guard Rhinos are ubiquitous and versatile armoured transports. They can move Death Guard squads rapidly across the battlefield in their festering holds, to take them to new battlefronts, bear them through hostile terrain or support armoured offensives.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague combi-bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Rhino
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 Death Guard Infantry models. It cannot transport Terminator, Cultist or Poxwalker models.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 additional plague combi-bolter

other.name: Tainted Narthecium
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, in your Command phase, you can return 1 destroyed Bodyguard model to that unit.

other.name: Diseased Healing
other.description: At the end of your Movement phase, you can select one friendly Death Guard Infantry Character model within 3" of this model. That model regains up to 3 lost wounds. Each model can only be selected for this ability once per turn.

datasheets.fluff: Equipped with narthecium-like instruments around which form filthy miasmas, Plague Surgeons carry vials and alembics full of boosters and macro-stimulants for countless plagues. By such means do they give the Death Guard renewed strength and resilience while inflaming the enemy’s infections to agonising degrees.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague bolt pistol; balesword.
datasheets.name: Plague Surgeon
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Vector of Disease
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, you can re-roll the Hit roll.

other.name: Abundance of Sickness
other.description: In the Fight phase, each time this model loses a wound, roll one D6: on a 4+, the closest enemy unit within Engagement Range of this model suffers 1 mortal wound.

datasheets.fluff: Lords of Contagion are the most aggressive Death Guard lords. Their tactics are as brutal and blunt as they are effective. Striding unharmed through torrents of enemy fire in their nigh impregnable Cataphractii Terminator plate, they sweep aside foes in violent bursts of gore with their snarl-toothed and corroded blades.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Blightlord Terminators ■ Deathshroud Terminators
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plagueblade.
datasheets.name: Lord of Contagion
wargear: None

other.name: Foul Infusion
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability. In addition, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, a Critical Hit is scored on an unmodified Hit roll of 5+, instead of only a 6.

other.name: Explosive Maladies
other.description: Once per battle round, you can target one unit from your army with this ability with the Grenade Stratagem for 0CP.

datasheets.fluff: Biologus Putrifiers take obscene delight in developing myriad plagues to spread in battle. They carry all manner of blight grenades, bloated with the latest strains of blossoming contagions. With their injector pistols, Biologus Putrifiers implant killing maladies into the enemy before extracting samples of their ruined flesh.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: hyper blight grenades; injector pistol; plague knives.
datasheets.name: Biologus Putrifier
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Putrescent Fog (Aura)
other.description: While a friendly Death Guard unit is wholly within 6" of this Fortification, each time an attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Diseased Cover
other.description: Each time a ranged attack is allocated to a model, if that model is not fully visible to every model in the attacking unit because of this Fortification, that model has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

other.name: Fortification
other.description:
While an enemy unit is only within Engagement Range of one or more Fortifications from your army:

■ That unit can still be selected as the target of ranged attacks, but each time such an attack is made, unless it is made with a Pistol, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
■ Models in that unit do not need to take Desperate Escape tests due to Falling Back while Battle-shocked, except for those that will move over enemy models when doing so.

datasheets.fluff: Festooned with swaying plague censers and tainted bells, Miasmic Malignifiers belch thick clouds of fumes from their rusted chimneys. Sown like spores across target worlds, they are parasites that suck filth from the ground and latch themselves on to local infrastructure, polluting the world on every level.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: noxious stink.
datasheets.name: Miasmic Malignifier
wargear: None

other.name: Hovering Death
other.description: This model is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

datasheets.fluff: The Foetid Bloat-drones’ trailing tubules suckle filth from the ground they hover over. They churn this substance before squirting the thick concoction over the enemy with plaguespitters, inflicting terrible maladies. Those with heavy blight launchers bombard foes with disease-ridden shells that can even rot heavy tanks.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: fleshmower; plague probe.
datasheets.name: Foetid Bloat-Drone
wargear: This model’s fleshmower can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 heavy blight launcher ◦ 2 plaguespitters

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Scuttling Walker
other.description: Each time this model makes a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move, it can move over friendly Monster and Vehicle models and terrain features that are 4" or less in height as if they were not there.

datasheets.fluff: The Nurgle Daemons trapped within Defilers adapt unusually well to their metallic prisons. Many gleefully realise the terrible mayhem they can inflict as they stomp on piston-driven legs, ripping open tanks with their massive claws or blowing apart enemy formations with volleys from their Defiler cannons.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Defiler cannon; reaper autocannon; twin heavy flamer; Defiler claws.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Defiler
wargear: This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague combi-bolter
This model’s reaper autocannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 twin lascannon ◦ 1 twin plague heavy bolter
This model’s twin heavy flamer can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 Defiler scourge ◦ 1 havoc launcher

damaged.description: While this model has 1-5 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Assault Ramp
other.description: Each time a unit disembarks from this model after it has made a Normal move, that unit is still eligible to declare a charge this turn.

datasheets.fluff: Equipped with a fearsome arsenal of weapons and large transport capacity, Land Raiders are destructive and versatile vehicles. Drenched in thick, stinking slime, Death Guard Land Raiders are host to scores of varieties of scratching, biting parasites, and sprout throbbing growths that emit fogs of foetid gas.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 soulshatter lascannons; twin plague heavy bolter; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Land Raider
datasheets.transport: This model has a transport capacity of 12 Death Guard Infantry models (excluding Cultist and Poxwalker models). Each Terminator model takes up the space of 2 models.
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague combi-bolter

other.name: Infused with the Blessings of Nurgle
other.description: Each time this model is selected to shoot or fight, after it has finished making its attacks, select one enemy unit that was hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is always considered to be within Contagion Range of this model.

other.name: Enraged Impact
other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it and roll one D6: on a 2+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

other.name: Helbrute Fists
other.description: If this model is equipped with two Helbrute fists, those weapons have the [TWIN-LINKED] ability.

datasheets.fluff: The most terribly wounded Death Guard are interred within the armoured sarcophagus of a Helbrute. Plague Surgeons take deep pleasure in sealing rivals and superiors inside these madness-inducing and agony-inflicting shells. In battle they are living, enraged battering rams, flushed with the blessings of Nurgle.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: multi-melta; missile launcher; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Helbrute
wargear: For each Helbrute fist this model is equipped with, it can be equipped with one of the following: ◦ 1 plague combi-bolter ◦ 1 heavy flamer
This model’s missile launcher can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 Helbrute fist ◦ 1 Helbrute hammer ◦ 1 power scourge
This model’s multi-melta can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 Helbrute plasma cannon ◦ 1 twin autocannon ◦ 1 twin lascannon ◦ 1 twin plague heavy bolter ◦ 1 Helbrute fist

other.name: Remorseless
other.description: While this unit is within range of an objective marker you control, each time you take a Battle-shock test for this unit, add 1 to that test.

datasheets.fluff: The mainstay of Death Guard vectoriums, Plague Marines excel in short-ranged firefights and relentless assaults that grind the enemy down. They are tactically astute, deploying plague spewers to drown hordes of enemies in noxious slime, and blight launchers to release crippling ironblight into armoured vehicles.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: plague boltgun; plague knives.
datasheets.name: Plague Marines
wargear: For every 5 models in this unit, up to 2 Plague Marines can each have their plague boltgun replaced with 1 heavy plague weapon.
For every 5 models in this unit, up to 2 Plague Marines can each have their plague boltgun replaced with 1 bubotic weapons.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Plague Marine’s plague boltgun can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 meltagun ◦ 1 plague belcher ◦ 1 plasma gun
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Plague Marine’s plague boltgun can be replaced with 1 plague spewer.
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Plague Marine’s plague boltgun can be replaced with 1 blight launcher.
The Plague Champion’s plague knives can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 bubotic weapons ◦ 1 heavy plague weapon
The Plague Champion’s plague boltgun can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 plague bolt pistol ◦ 1 plasma gun ◦ 1 plasma pistol

other.name: Putrescent Vitality (Psychic)
other.description: At the start of the Fight phase, you can roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker’s unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2+, until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in this Psyker’s unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.

other.name: Pestilent Familiar (Psychic)
other.description:
Once per battle, after selecting targets for a Psychic weapon equipped by this model, until the end of the phase, improve the Strength and Damage characteristics of that weapon by 2.

Designer’s Note: Place a Pestilent Familiar token next to this model, removing it once this ability has been used.

composition: 1 Death Guard Sorcerer in Terminator Armour
datasheets.fluff: Powerful Sorcerers are able to equip themselves with highly durable, diseased Terminator armour. Able to teleport strike alongside Blightlord or Deathshroud Terminators, these Sorcerers curse their foes immediately upon arrival on the battlefield, weakening and draining them of life within seconds.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Blightlord Terminators ■ Deathshroud Terminators
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Curse of the Leper; plague combi-bolter; force weapon.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Sorcerer in Terminator Armour

profiles.name: Curse of the Leper – Focused witchfire

stats.name: Death Guard Sorcerer in Terminator Armour

wargear: This model’s plague combi-bolter and force weapon can be replaced with 1 twin lighting claws.
This model’s force weapon can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 chainfist ◦ 1 plague fist ◦ 1 plague-encrusted exalted weapon
This model’s plague combi-bolter can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague-encrusted exalted weapon

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Destructor
other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets an Infantry unit, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

datasheets.fluff: These pustule-covered battle tanks provide mobile fire support for advancing infantry. They can shatter infantry formations and cripple enemy armour, all whilst shrugging off storms of return fire.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: predator autocannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Predator Destructor
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague combi-bolter
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 2 lascannons ◦ 2 plague heavy bolters

other.name: The Destroyer Hive
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a melee attack targets that unit, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: The Eater Plague (Psychic)
other.description: In your Shooting phase, you can select one enemy unit within 18" of and visible to this Psyker and roll one D6: on a 1, this Psyker’s unit suffers D3 mortal wounds; on a 2-5, that enemy unit suffers D6 mortal wounds; on a 6, that enemy unit suffers D3+3 mortal wounds.

datasheets.fluff: Host of the Destroyer Hive, for millennia Typhus has travelled the galaxy, spreading Nurgle’s Rot and killing billions. When he takes to the field, he slices apart countless foes with his filth-encrusted power scythe and unleashes the swarming horror of his Destroyer Hive to engulf them in murderous plague-flies.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Blightlord Terminators ■ Deathshroud Terminators ■ Poxwalkers
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: master-crafted manreaper.
datasheets.name: Typhus
wargear: None

other.name: Grandfather’s Blessing (Aura, Psychic)
other.description: While a friendly Death Guard Infantry unit is within Contagion Range of this model, models in that unit have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

datasheets.fluff: Daemonhood is the ultimate goal for a great many Heretic Astartes. Those Nurgle worshippers who succeed are lumbering monstrosities with formidable resilience, corroded armour and bloated flesh. They command sepsis cohorts and vectoriums, having retained all their tactical acumen and martial skill.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague spewer; hellforged weapons.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Daemon Prince
wargear: None

other.name: Blistering Fusillade
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a ranged attack, if it targets the closest eligible enemy unit, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

datasheets.fluff: Blightlord Terminators are formidably tough thanks to their Cataphractii plate and Nurgle’s gifts, and are experts in breach assaults, boarding actions and sudden teleport strikes. Due to long periods spent aboard pox-ridden warships, they are saturated with foulness, which pours off them to rot flesh and corrode metal.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: plague combi-bolter; bubotic blade.
datasheets.name: Blightlord Terminators
wargear: For every 5 models in this unit:  ◦ Up to 3 models’ plague combi-bolters can each be replaced with 1 combi-weapon. ◦ 1 Blightlord Terminator’s plague combi-bolter can be replaced with one of the following: 1 blight launcher; 1 reaper autocannon. ◦ 1 Blightlord Terminator’s plague combi-bolter can be replaced with 1 plague spewer. ◦ 1 Blightlord Terminator’s plague combi-bolter and bubotic blade can be replaced with 1 flail of corruption.
leadBy: Death Guard Chaos Lord in Terminator Armour
Death Guard Sorcerer in Terminator Armour

other.name: Curse of the Walking Pox
other.description:
Each time a model in this unit makes an attack that destroys an enemy model (excluding Monster and Vehicle models), you can return one destroyed Poxwalker model to this unit.

While Typhus is leading this unit, enemy models destroyed as a result of Typhus’ The Eater Plague ability count as enemy models destroyed by an attack made by a model in this unit for the purposes of this ability.

datasheets.fluff: Poxwalkers are victims of the Walking Pox, a cruel virulence that rots the infected to death while keeping them conscious. They are terror troops, their ceaseless groaning the vector by which they infect the living. In battle they drown their foes in a sea of decaying flesh, clawing hands and gnashing teeth.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: improvised weapon.
datasheets.name: Poxwalkers
wargear: None

other.name: Putrefying Stink
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, models in that unit have the Fights First ability.

datasheets.fluff: Upon a Foul Blightspawn’s back is a malignant churn. As he cranks its rusted handle, he mixes a foul concoction of bubbling diseases and pollutants. Once satisfied his burbling blend of choking stew is ready, he levels his plague sprayer at the foe. Out his mixture surges like projectile vomit, melting whatever it touches.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague sprayer; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Foul Blightspawn
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Chaos Lord
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Hit roll of 1.

other.name: Desiccation Conduit (Aura)
other.description: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this model, at the end of the turn, roll one D6: on a 4+, that enemy unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

datasheets.fluff: Death Guard Lords hold positions of command throughout the Legion’s structure. All are powerful warriors, proving their right to rule through acts of destruction, corruption and endurance. They combine all the tactical nous of a Space Marine champion with a deep-seated desire to spread Grandfather Nurgle’s blessings.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague bolt pistol; Astartes chainsword.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Chaos Lord
wargear: This model’s plague bolt pistol and Astartes chainsword can be replaced with 1 twin lighting claws.
This model’s Astartes chainsword can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 plague fist ◦ 1 plague-encrusted exalted weapon
This model’s plague bolt pistol can be replaced with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague combi-bolter ◦ 1 plague fist ◦ 1 plague-encrusted exalted weapon ◦ 1 plasma pistol

other.name: Sickening Vitality
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, you can re-roll Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

other.name: The Bell Tolls (Aura)
other.description: While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of this model, each time a Battle-shock or Leadership test is taken for that enemy unit, subtract 2 from that test.

datasheets.fluff: Cursed plague bells tolling, Noxious Blightbringers sow weakness among the enemy. Each rippling sound wave erodes the enemy’s will to fight and spawns maggots in the minds of psykers. To the Death Guard the sound is beautiful, and upon hearing it they surge eagerly into the fray.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same Leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plasma pistol; cursed plague bell.
datasheets.name: Noxious Blightbringer
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same Leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Regenerating Monstrosities
other.description: At the start of each player’s Command phase, one model in this unit regains up to D3 lost wounds.

datasheets.fluff: Many of Nurgle’s gifts take the form of metaphysical maladies, parasitic infestations or physical mutations. Some become so overburdened by them that they suddenly and horrifically change in a rupture of bulged armour and skin. All that is left of them is a Chaos Spawn, a crazed monstrosity that lives only to kill and feed.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: hideous mutations.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Chaos Spawn
wargear: None

damaged.description: While this model has 1-6 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Host of Plagues
other.description: At the start of the battle round, select one of the abilities in the Host of Plagues section. Until the start of the next battle round, this model has that ability.

other.name: Lord of the Death Guard (Aura)
other.description: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 6" of this model, that unit can ignore any or all modifiers to its characteristics and to any roll or test made for it (excluding modifiers to saving throws).

abilities.name: Miasma of Pestilence (Aura)
abilities.description: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 6" of this model, each time a ranged attack targets that unit, models in that unit have the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

abilities.name: Diseased Influence (Aura)
abilities.description: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 6" of this model, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, re-roll a Wound roll of 1.

abilities.name: Toxic Presence (Aura)
abilities.description: While a friendly Death Guard unit is within 12" of this model, add 3" to the Contagion Range of that unit.

special.description: If this model is in your army, it must be your Warlord.
special.name: Supreme Commander

datasheets.fluff: To stand in Mortarion’s presence is lethal, such is the pestilential aura that surrounds him. Wielding his gigantic scythe, Silence, he cuts apart entire enemy squads in seconds. With furious blasts of Lantern, his devastating sidearm of unknown provenance, he disintegrates heavy infantry and armour alike.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Rotwind; the Lantern; Silence.
datasheets.name: Mortarion
wargear: None

other.name: Warp Horror (Psychic)
other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, select one enemy unit within Engagement Range of it. That unit must take a Battle-shock test.

other.name: Devastating Assault
other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, until the end of the turn, its hellforged weapons have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

composition: 1 Death Guard Daemon Prince with Wings
datasheets.fluff: The wings that sprout from the backs of chosen Death Guard may resemble the buzzing appendages of bloated flies, or take a pocked and diseased chiropteran form. Regardless of their shape, they bear the Daemon Prince aloft, allowing him to descend upon his luckless foes from above and spread fearsome maladies over the battlefield with ease.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague spewer; hellforged weapons.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Daemon Prince with Wings

stats.name: Death Guard Daemon Prince with Wings

wargear: None

datasheets.fluff: On every Human world there is disease. Therefore the potential for cults of Nurgle to arise is ever present, the worshippers taking a perverse pride in their maladies and disfigurements. When these Cultists strike their enemies, they do so in massed numbers, inured to pain and deranged by their fevered minds.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Cultist firearm; brutal assault weapon.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Cultists
wargear: For every 10 models in the unit, 1 Death Guard Cultist’s Cultist firearm can be replaced with 1 grenade launcher.
For every 10 models in the unit, 1 Death Guard Cultist’s Cultist firearm can be replaced with 1 heavy stubber.
For every 10 models in the unit, 1 Death Guard Cultist’s Cultist firearm can be replaced with 1 flamer.

other.name: Unclean Icon
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in that unit.

other.name: Seed the Disease
other.description: Once per battle, at the end of your Movement phase, this model can use this ability. If it does, until the start of your next Command phase, this model’s unit is treated as having a Contagion Range of 12".

datasheets.fluff: The icons borne by the Death Guard are rusted and corrupted dedications to Nurgle, forged into the shape of the Grandfather’s symbol. So wreathed in disease are these banners that nearby enemies are rapidly afflicted, dying agonising deaths as their convulsing bodies are reduced to slop.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plague boltgun; plague knife.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Icon Bearer
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it. If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

other.name: Malicious Calculations
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll.

other.name: The Seven-fold Chant
other.description: In your Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, roll 2D6: on a 7+, you gain 1CP.

datasheets.fluff: The Tallymen are the preachers of Nurgle’s sevenfold doctrine. They are bedecked with rotten scrolls covered in frenzied scrawls and tallies. Nurglings crawl around them, bearing more tomes and parchments. Through gigantic vox speakers Tallymen bellow incantations, spurring on the Death Guard.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Plague Marines You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: infected plasma pistol; close combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Tallyman
wargear: None

leads.extra: You can attach this model to a Plague Marines unit, even if one other Leader unit has already been attached to it (you cannot attach more than one of the same leader to the same unit). If you do, and that Bodyguard unit is destroyed, the Leader units attached to it become separate units, with their original Starting Strengths.

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Annihilator
other.description: Each time this model makes a ranged attack that targets a Monster or Vehicle unit, re-roll a Damage roll of 1.

datasheets.fluff: Capable of firing with pinpoint accuracy, Predator Annihilators are precision tools that can eliminate key threats. In so doing they allow the Legion’s infantry to advance into the fray and spread Nurgle’s gifts.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Predator twin lascannon; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Predator Annihilator
wargear: This model can be equipped with 1 havoc launcher.
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 1 combi-weapon ◦ 1 plague combi-bolter
This model can be equipped with one of the following:  ◦ 2 lascannons ◦ 2 plague heavy bolters

damaged.description: While this model has 1-4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

other.name: Spore-laced Shock Waves
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model has shot, if one or more of those attacks made with its Plagueburst mortar scored a hit against an enemy Infantry unit, that Infantry unit must take a Battle-shock test.

datasheets.fluff: The brainchild of Mortarion himself, the Plagueburst Crawler is a hulking Daemon Engine possessed of huge ram-blades and thick armour plating that renders it incredibly resilient. Equipped with Plagueburst mortars, they launch hideously powerful explosive shells that unleash clouds of corrosive spores upon detonation.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: 2 entropy cannons; heavy slugger; Plagueburst mortar; armoured tracks.
datasheets.name: Plagueburst Crawler
wargear: This model’s heavy slugger can be replaced with 1 rothail volley gun.
This model’s 2 entropy cannons can be replaced with 2 plaguespitters.

other.name: Master of Destruction
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a ranged attack, you can re-roll the Wound roll.

other.name: Blight Bombardment
other.description: Each time a friendly Death Guard model makes an attack with a Blast weapon that targets a unit that is visible to this model, add 1 to the Hit roll and that attack has the [IGNORES COVER] ability.

datasheets.fluff: Tubes and pipes erupt in profusion from the Lord of Virulence’s armour. From these gout noxious fumes, putrid eruptions whose hue and stench guide the fire of artillery engines behind the lines. Behind them their flensefrond cloaks leave a trail of sickening mucosal slime for hungry Daemon Engines to follow.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ Blightlord Terminators ■ Deathshroud Terminators
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: twin plague spewer; heavy plague fist.
datasheets.name: Lord of Virulence
wargear: None

other.description: Each time this unit makes a Charge move, until the end of the turn, weapons equipped by models in this unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.
other.name: Infectious Bloodshed

special.description: For the purposes of embarking within Transports, each Death Guard Possessed model counts as one Terminator model.
special.name: POSSESSED

wargear.description: Melee weapons in the bearer's unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
wargear.name: Diseased Icon

datasheets.loadout: Each model is equipped with: hideous mutations.
datasheets.name: Death Guard Possessed
wargear: 1 model can be equipped with 1 diseased icon.

enhancements.name: Living Plague
enhancements.description: Death Guard model only. Add 3" to the range of the bearer’s Aura abilities (including Nurgle’s Gift).

enhancements.name: The Droning (Aura)
enhancements.description: Death Guard model only. While an enemy unit is within Contagion Range of the bearer, each time that unit fails a Battle-shock test, roll one D6: on a 2-5, that unit suffers 1 mortal wound; on a 6, that unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.

enhancements.name: Deadly Pathogen
enhancements.description: Death Guard model only. Add 1 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons. While the bearer is within range of an Infected objective marker you control, add 2 to the Strength and Attacks characteristics of the bearer’s melee weapons instead.

enhancements.name: Shamblerot
enhancements.description: Death Guard model only. Each time the bearer’s unit is selected as a target of an enemy unit’s charge, until the end of the phase, subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for that enemy unit.

stratagems.name: Ferric Blight
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1. If the target of that attack is within Contagion Range of an Infected objective marker you control and a Critical Wound is scored for that attack, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 2 instead.
stratagems.fluff: The spreading rust of the Ferric Blight can reduce armour of all kinds to nothing.

stratagems.name: Sanguous Flux
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability. While your unit is within range of an Infected objective marker you control, those weapons have the [SUSTAINED HITS 2] ability instead.
stratagems.fluff: Bleeding sores erupt all over enemies afflicted by the Sanguous Flux, the wounds never clotting or healing.

stratagems.name: Disgustingly Resilient
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: Those favoured by Nurgle are inured to pain, their rotting bodies shrugging off all but the most traumatic damage with ease.

stratagems.name: Gifts of Decay
stratagems.target: One Death Guard model from your army.
stratagems.effect: Your model regains up to D3 lost wounds. If your model’s unit is within Contagion Range of an Infected objective marker you control, your model regains up to 3 lost wounds instead.
stratagems.fluff: Nurgle is a generous god, and through worship and devotion his followers can gain mighty rewards as they spread sickness in his name.

stratagems.name: Boilblight
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army, and one enemy unit within Contagion Range of that unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a weapon equipped by a Death Guard model from your army targets that enemy unit, that weapon has the [HEAVY] and [IGNORES COVER] abilities.
stratagems.fluff: The strange lumps that form on victims of Boilblight – also known as Nurgle’s Fruit, Lumpen Splatter or the Crawling Pustulence – are easy to spot at a distance for the Death Guard.

stratagems.name: Cloud of Flies
stratagems.target: One Death Guard unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability.
stratagems.fluff: With a thrumming roar, a thick cloud of daemon flies whirls around the Death Guard and obscures them from the enemy’s sight.
